creator: ralph.curtis@gabrielsoftware.com
text:
Movement of log4jMini to sandbox:

----- comments from carnold at apache.org --------------------------
I moved log4jMini to the sandbox since it appeared to be an  
independent product from log4j, that is it had its own release cycle,  
didn't contribute to the log4j distributions, etc.  The sandbox is  
the place for experiments or efforts that might become full fledged  
products with PMC support behind them.  I don't think log4jMini fits  
into that category yet.
------- end comment ------------------------------------------

Ralph Curtis:
I am raising this bug to address the problem that log4jMini (log4j limited 
embedded version) is in need of an overhaul. It needs to be brought more in 
line with the main project to make it more compatible. Better compatibility 
will support portability of software using log4j from J2SE to J2ME (CDC). Among 
other things, log4jMini is still using Category instead of Logger class.

log4jMini can now be found in the sandbox at:
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/sandbox/log4j/log4jMini

I will address this issue with a log4jMini patch in the very near future.

creator: ralph.curtis@gabrielsoftware.com
text:
Changes I have made with with patch of 2005-12-08 21:16:
- Refactored Category and related category oriented classes to Logger and
related logger oriented classes for compatibility with main log4j project.
- Added pattern types %d, %D for specifying date and time. Similar but not the
same as log4j.
- Added a ConsoleAppender for further compatibility with main log4j project.
- Fixed examples so that they work with changes.
- Corrected javadoc problems where found.
- Cleaned up the build script. Builds as version 1_3alpha_7

Initial patch committed with mods as r 370187.

ConsoleAppender was not in patch file.  Usage commented out in Hello.java. 
Please  attach ConsoleAppender.java as attachment to this bug.

CategoryKey was apparently renamed as LoggerKey, but LoggerKey was not included
in patch.  However, CategoryKey in log4j apparently offered some performance
improvement with very early JVM's, but now is slower and causes other problems.
 See http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=35052.  In log4j,
CategoryKey could not be eliminated (or renamed) since it is visible as part of
the API, but since you felt free to rename it, I felt free to replace its use
with String.

The patches for Logger.java and RootLogger.java had rejected sections, so I
manually applied the changes.

log4jMini still has ASL 1.1 header files which should be updated to ASL 2.0.  I
think there is a header updater program around and will attempt to apply it soon.
